question: What is use of IPAM in MonetX?
response: In this module MonetX is fetching data of configured IP on the network devices physical interfaces SVi and Virtual interfaces LIKE  HSRP, VRRP & LB virtual IP. It is also s the interface description, vlan name, subnet, Subnets mask and the status of the physical interface up or down. The benefit of this module is to track any ip from the dashboard & does not need to login to device. in monetX it have capability to add DHCP server as a node and fetch the IP scopes information like Scope name, Lease, used addresses, free addresses etc. and you can manually and  dynamically discover subnets in your environment to get there IP details like where it is configured. Mac address and which ports are open on that IP address and it is also maintaining the ip history with time series if these is MAC change on specific IP it will prompt.

question: How are top 10 subnet by IP address are displayed on dashboard?
response: In the monitoring module MonetX is monitoring all added devices interface so it will show those interface which are highly utilized.

question: What is TCP open port graph displaying?
response: In IPAM module MonetX is scanning through NMAP and getting the data of open TCP ports on specific IP, it is also beneficial for security purpose it will show also the unsecured opened port in your environment

question: What is Ip availability summary showing?
response: In IPAM dashboard there is widget called Ip availability summary  you can directly go to used and unused IP by just  single click

question: What is subnet summary showing?
response: In IPAM dashboard there is widget called subnet summary is show how many subnets you manually enter for scanning and how many subnets discovered from devices

question: How can I get top 10 subnet by ip address used?
response: In IPAM dashboard there is widget called Top 10 subnets by IP used it will show the subnet detail in %

question: How can we get ip availability summary of all devices?
response: In IPAM dashboard there is widget called Ip availability summary  you can directly go to used and unused IP by just  single click

question: How can we get ip availability summary of single device?
response: In IPAM dashboard there is widget called Ip availability summary  you can directly go to used and unused IP by just  single click and filter the subnet which you want to check

question: How can we get TCP open ports?
response: In subnet table ad single ip or complete subnet and click scan button  and check the ports option it will scan the ports on single ip or on complete subnet

question: What does discovered from device mean in subnet summary?
response: In subnet table the option to discover a subnet from device and scan its DNS resolution, TCP open ports and MAC

question: How can I manually add subnet summary?
response: Login to MonetX click IPAM click subnet then add subnet with netmask, name and location then click on scan

question: What do you mean by DNS not received?
response: Once you add the or discovered the subnet in IPAM it will also resolve the IP with FQDN if there is no entry available in DNS server it will show either wise it will not resolved

question: What do you mean by DNS received?
response: Once you add the or discovered the subnet in IPAM it will also resolve the IP with FQDN if there is entry available in DNS server it will show either wise it will resolved

response: In this module MonetX is fetching data of configured IP on the network devices physical interfaces SVi and Virtual interfaces LIKE  HSRP, VRRP & LB virtual IP. It is also s the interface description, vlan name, subnet, Subnets mask and the status of the physical interface up or down. The benefit of this module is to track any ip from the dashboard & does not need to login to device. in monetX it have capability to add DHCP server as a node and fetch the IP scopes information like Scope name, Lease, used addresses, free addresses etc. and you can manually and  dynamically discover subnets in your environment to get there IP details like where it is configured. Mac address and which ports are open on that IP address and it is also maintaining the ip history with time series if these is MAC change on specific IP it will prompt.

question: How can we export devices in IPAM?
response: Bulk import Via Excel Sheet  Click Export Template --- Fill the Excel Sheet ---  Import Excel --- Select devices and click on board --- Devices will be onboarded successfully.

question: What devices can be added in IPAM?
response: While adding device click on device type it will show which type of devices you can onboard on monetX

question: What are different sources for adding device?
response: adding a Single Device and Bulk import Via Excel Sheet

question: How can we add device from atom?
response: adding a Single Device Click Atom --- Add Atom --- Fill out the all required details ---  Add password Group --- Done  Select the device ---  click onboard --- Decives will be onboarded successfully.

question: What is password group when adding a new device?
response: Atom --- Password Group --- Add password Group --- fill the details --- Done

question: Can we recover deleted device?
response: You need to re onboard

question: What is MonetX?
response: MonetX is a Network automation tool it have different modules like Dynamic inventory MGMT, IPAM, DCCM, RBAC Monitoring

question: What's the features of MonetX?
response: Dynamic inventory MGMT, IPAM, DCCM, RBAC Monitoring

question: Who uses the MonetX?
response: MonetX users can be Managers, Admins, Network Engineer, System Engineers and Planning engineers

question: Can I customize the menu with my own uses of MonetX?
response: It is highly customizable, it can give shape to any idea

question: Who are the competitors of MonetX?
response: SolarWinds, Manage Engine

question: What is  the unique things of MonetX?
response: It is highly customizable, Secure, Low Cost, with free Demo installation for 30 days

question: What is the requirements of installing the MonetX?
response: Inventory To deal with rapid technological advancements, businesses often make changes to their network infrastructure, which can create a lot of problems. Manually tracking and compiling data is a time-consuming process that often leads to overlooking devices, entering data incorrectly, and making compilation errors. Therefore, every business needs a network inventory management tool to organize and manage network configurations. When it comes to managing network devices and organizing network assets to track configurations, a network inventory management software is vital. Let's look at the different components that make up holistic network inventory management system: There 2 methods to add device in MonetX 1: Static one be one & 2: Import excel sheet (Atom) which contains list of devices such as IP address, Location, Rack detail, SW type ETC. Once devices are added in Atom with static information. Tool have button to onboard device this algorithm will communicate will devices over the (SSH, APIs, SMNP) and get dynamic information from the devices like status, Serial No, PN code, patch Version, Manufacturer, vendor and HW version along with this our system have capability to fetch information of  boards, sub Boards and SFPs, like if the there is a stack switch it will show the stack members and all information of each stack member. In sub boards our tool is dynamically fetching information power supplies, fan tray, ethernet and SFP module, supervisor engines and route processors. In SFP our tool is fetching information of each SFP like SFP model, Speed, Mode, Serial No. Manufacturer, wave length, PN code and the name of the port where it is connected.  Data Center Capacity Management In DCM module our tool fetching the information of total interface counts, connected, and not connected ports counts & also It will show the count of all unused SFPs for all variations like 1G, 10G, 40G and 100G. With this data you can do any type of analytics like total unused SFP, total Connected ports etc IPAM In this module MonetX is fetching data of configured IP on the network devices physical interfaces, VLAN interfaces and Virtual IP like HSRP or VRRP. It is also storing the interface description, vlan name, subnet, Subnets mask and the status of the physical and the admin interface up or down. The benefit of this module is to track any ip from the dashboard & does not need to login to device. in monetX it have capability to add DHCP server as a node and fetch the IP scopes information like Scope name, Lease, used addresses, free addresses etc. and you can manually and  dynamically discover subnets in your environment to get there IP details like where it is configured and which ports are open on that IP address

With this data you can do any type of analytics like total unused SFP, total Connected ports etc

question: What is SFPS?
response: Small Form-factor Pluggable is a compact, hot-pluggable network interface module format used for both telecommunication and data communications applications. An SFP interface on networking hardware is a modular slot for a media-specific transceiver, such as for a fiber-optic cable or a copper cable

question: DNS Services mean?
response: In IPAM montX have ability to add DNS server and it will show its zones and DNS records

question: What is DCM?
response: Data Center Capacity Management In DCM module our tool fetching the information of total interface counts, connected, and not connected ports counts & also It will show the count of all unused SFPs for all variations like 1G, 10G, 40G and 100G. With this data you can do any type of analytics like total unused SFP, total Connected ports etc

question: What is monitoring?
response: Network monitoring is the use of a system that constantly monitors a computer network for slow or failing components and that notifies the network administrator in case of outages or other trouble. Network monitoring is part of network management.
